item.title: Variance: How to detect Suspicious Data Citizen
item.description: Previously, we’ve covered why the mean is a great measure of central trend. In short: it allows just one number to describe a whole set of values. But the middle one also has a downside. It is unstable to strong outliers in the data. For example, if in one dataset we described the salaries of ordinary citizens and one (but what) salary of a conditional deputy. In this case, the average result for the group can be highly distorted.
